botanical_details.genus: Phaseolus are annual or perennial legumes, usually climbing or trailing in form, and with trifoliate leaves. Grown as crop plants for their edible seeds, including runner, French and lima beans, as well as for animal feed, green manures and as ornamentals

how_to_grow.cultivation: Start from seed in a heated greenhouse or warm windowsill, and plant outside once all risk of frost has passed in a sunny, sheltered site. Incorporate bulky organic material into the soil before planting, and keep the soil moist when plants are flowering to ensure the beans set. Plants need substantial supports. See runner beans (Grow your own)
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove shoot tips once they reach the top of the support
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to slugs and snails, black bean aphid, and birds
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to foot rot
